column4: god, i don't know whats happening to my computer.  now i have no more panels as of today when i turnd it on... i figured out how to go in thru the filesystem to usr/bin to find programs, but what a pain.  all this started when i tried to upgrade my video card driver for an installation of google earth.  anyone else having such a prob?
my screen resolution is all goofy too, i don't really know what it is rendering at, but it ain't very high i can say.
what videocard do you have exactly?
don't "believe", it's not an article of faith. CHECK instead
i checked, the system detects tnt2,  i say i bilieve, cause i wasn't sure if it was accurate
if you have a cli you already have a terminal...
any idea where i find the terminal in the filesystem?  its not listed as terminal in usr/bin ... ?
you said you are starting the programs via terminal. so you already have one
no, i said i was launching by clicking on the filesystem icon on the desktop
i can't copy/paste from the xterm apparently, but the output says : vga compat controller: nvidia NV%M^$ (RIVA TNT2 Model 64/Model 64 Pro)(Rev 15)
i can't copy/paste from the xterm apparently, but the output says : vga compat controller: nvidia NV%M^$ (RIVA TNT2 Model 64/Model 64 Pro)(Rev 15)
then you need nvidia legacy drivers
you still here, i don't know i think i was knocked off, everything just reset on chatzilla
